meanings.definition: Cobia: a large marine fish found in tropical and subtropical waters.
meanings.sent1: The cobias swam gracefully in the clear blue ocean.
meanings.sent2: I saw a school of cobias while snorkeling in the warm sea.
meanings.sent3: The cobias decided to have a race to see who was the fastest swimmer.
meanings.sent4: The cobias in the aquarium were like shimmering jewels in the water.
meanings.sent5: The cobias' silver scales glistened under the sunlight.

meanings.definition: Cobia: to try to persuade someone to do something by making it seem attractive or exciting.
meanings.sent1: She cobias her friends to join her on the thrilling roller coaster ride.
meanings.sent2: The salesman tried to cobias me into buying the latest model of the phone.
meanings.sent3: He cobias his little sister to share her toys by promising to play with her later.
meanings.sent4: The politician's speech was full of attempts to cobias the audience to vote for him.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used treats to cobias the students to participate in the class activity.
